p: The experimental results found that the incubation of the Spike-ACE2 complex with these naturally occurring triterpenoids reduced the Spike-ACE2 binding in a concentration-dependent way. Among all the compounds mentioned, betulinic and oleanolic acid showed significant inhibition at a concentration of 0.1 µM and 10 µM, respectively [ 122]. Interestingly, the pre-incubation of oleanolic and glycyrrhetinic acid with Spike-ACE2 complex exhibited a more remarkable ability to reduce the interaction between them and biological targets [ 122].
